thread.title: Dez Bryant has ‘chance’ to return Week 7
thread.title_full: Dez Bryant has ‘chance’ to return Week 7

author: Steve DelVecchio
title: Dez Bryant has ‘chance’ to return Week 7
text:
0 0 
The Dallas Cowboys have already lost the two games they have played without both Tony Romo and Dez Bryant, and one of those two star players has a chance to return in the very near future. 
On Monday, Cowboys executive vice president Stephen Jones said Bryant could be back on the field in Week 7 against the New York Giants when Dallas comes out of the bye. Jones told 103.5 KRLD The Fan that Bryant has had “no setbacks” and has a “real shot” to play against the Giants, according to The Dallas Morning News . 
The timetable for Romo’s return remains unclear, though the quarterback has already confirmed that he will not undergo surgery . Assuming there are no major changes, it’s a virtual certainty that Bryant will be back before Romo. 
Bryant broke a bone in his foot in the Cowboys’ season-opening win over the G-Men on Sept. 13. The the initial timetable for his recovery was 4-6 weeks. NFL Media’s Ian Rapoport later reported that Bryant is expected to miss 10-12 weeks after undergoing a bone graft , while ESPN’s Ed Werder said the bone graft performed should help and result in a 6-8 week recovery period. 
Jerry Jones recently revealed that Bryant told him the pain in his foot is going away . 
If you saw the video of Bryant jumping around like a madman on his broken foot , you know how badly he wants to return to action. While the Cowboys have lost their last two games, they would be wise not to rush him back. Filed Under:
